trigger_event: Daria, entrusted with system-level access during the vacuum after the referendum, discovers Halden’s encrypted data vault alongside guidance scripts only she is authorized to unlock—both with the power to reshape the city’s future.
dilemma: Daria must choose whether to release Halden’s damning recordings, exposing Council crimes and sparking citywide reckoning, or to suspend all authority and guide the city into a time of shared grieving and renewal, using only Halden’s empathetic messages.
reason: Daria is torn: Alex’s words linger—‘Truth or healing, there’s rarely both.’ She feels the raw weight of responsibility, knowing that choosing one path will forever shut out the other. Her heart aches for honest justice but fears the damage it could cause. Her hands hover, undecided, at the controls.
choice_a: Release Halden’s recordings to the public, igniting outrage, confrontation, and the city’s final break with the old regime.
belief_a: Unmasking corruption is the only path to real freedom.
Justice demands that everyone see what was hidden, no matter the pain.
Systems built on lies can only be rebuilt through total honesty.
choice_b: Lock away the recordings and push for a total suspension of government, inviting the whole city to mourn, reflect and rebuild together instead.
belief_b: Communities heal best when given space for compassion, not vengeance.
Real transformation starts with shared experience, not sensational exposure.
Sometimes mercy—not justice—is what breaks cycles of harm.
